      • justDirStructure

        public Listing justDirStructure()

        A listing with all of the directories removed.

      • findAFile

        public java.lang.String findAFile()
        Finds the first available file i.e. non Listing = directory in this Listing. Recursion again!

      • recurseAndEdit

        public Listing recurseAndEdit(int mode,
                     java.lang.String s)
        Recurses this list and returns and editted version i.e. a refined search on specific file name matches or Listings with directory occurances removed.

      • matched

        public boolean matched(java.lang.String item,
              java.lang.String matchStr)
        matches the file to the given matching string. The matching String can contain waitForWilcards etc and this unction will match accordingly.

      • elementAt

        public java.lang.Object elementAt(int i)
        Returns:
        the ith element within the Listing. This could be a File or a Listing.

      • toStrings

        public java.lang.String[] toStrings(boolean longFormat)
        Returns:
        a listing as a set of Strings. If longFormat is true then the format of the listing will be in long format (i.e. with file details etc).

      • convertToStrings

        public java.lang.String[] convertToStrings()
        Recurses through the Listing and returns an array of strings containing each element within the Listing.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(boolean longFormat)
        Returns:
        a listing as a string with carriage returns between each item. If longFormat is true then the format of the listing will be in long format (i.e. with file details etc).

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a listing as a strings not in long format.
